items.title: Real life RPG 2
items.summary: After the live event that happened back in Real life RPG 1 this sequel came out, featuring a brand new map and a…
items.content_html:
After the live event that happened back in Real life RPG 1 this sequel came out, featuring a brand new map and a bunch of new features, an old friend named InfinityZockerA9 helped me a bit with it, but i did all of the programming and most other things, this is one of the biggest game's i've ever made, it has so much content we had serious stability issues, and even now the game always crashes when you're playing with more than 2 people, for a while we coudn't even get into the game ourselves because it was too overloaded with stuff.

This game features a better looking map than the first one, house upgrades, dreams, a mine, upgrades to buy, secret minigames and a lot more, it even saves your progress now and the game doesn't end anymore after a certain time limit, meaning if you buy a house for example, it will still be there the next time to play the game.

We even used to have npc's that move around the map but we had to scrap it as it would make the performance even worse. There were never any life events for this part though, the game is pretty much a finished, unevolving work.

items.title: Real life RPG 1
items.summary: I wanted to do something special, this was a little game where you could buy houses, hang out and do all kinds of…
items.content_html:
I wanted to do something special, this was a little game where you could buy houses, hang out and do all kinds of other activities, but eventually, the world would end, and you would be teleported to a shop where you could buy in-game cosmetic items and more with stuff you earned while playing the game.Â 

I added more content to the game as time went on, but i decided to do it in a unique way, for the most important updates i decided to do live events, similar to those you would see in games like Fortnite, these would be one-time events that would build up lore and story and also update the map with more content. I recorded the last live event on YouTube.

A problem with these live events would be that they weren't officially supported by the engine and game platform i used (LittleBigPlanet) so i had to do some workarounds to get it to work (i even faked interaction between other players on the server), there wasn't actually a server being updated live, in reality i updated the whole game a bit before the announced live event would start, knowing that the players of the old version will have been kicked out of the game by now, since the game ends eventually, as i mentioned. So that new build would contain the live event and after the live event is over the players would either be transfered to an unlisted version of the newest build with all of the changes made by the live event being in effect, the new map etc, or the changes would just be done on the live event build they're currently on too, then i updated the build while they were still in the game to the post-live event version, so if they'd leave the game and rejoin they woudn't see the live event again and instead the aftermath of the event that happened.

The problem with this is: what would happen if a player joined right before the live event was to start but after i already updated to the live event build, they would be slightly out of sync, but thats not even that bad, the real issue lies within what would happen if someone decided to restart the level or leave it during the event and rejoin, the live event would repeat!

Anyway, i dont think that ever really happened though, so thats good. Eventually the final live event lead up to the entire map being destroyed and Real life RPG 2 to come out!

items.summary: This is a little platformer where you have to swing across clouds, there are a few extra obstacles along the way, for example…
items.content_html:
This is a little platformer where you have to swing across clouds, there are a few extra obstacles along the way, for example at some point you need to bring a mother cloud her son back so she lets you through, but it all goes by pretty quickly.

I made this completely on my own, but i think it's a fun short little platformer, even though there are a few bugs.

items.title: Introduction
items.summary: Hey! I'm Toyo and i'm interested in all kinds of tech, game developement and art. Over the years i've gained a lot of…
items.content_html:
Hey! I'm Toyo and i'm interested in all kinds of tech, game developement and art.
Over the years i've gained a lot of knowledge about the general concepts of programming,
largely through a game series called "LittleBigPlanet".

LittleBigPlanet introduced me to the concept of programming and game developement
at an early age, over the years i mastered it until i was pretty much able to programm anything
in it. It's shocking how powerful the visual programming language of that series is,
i wished it would've been on pc and allowed you to export your games but sadly everything
that you create in it is locked to inside of the game.

In the meantime they've also released another engine-game called "Dreams" but at this
point i wasn't dedicated to fully learning that anymore, it also has the exact same problems
as its predecessor.

So now i'm starting to learn "real" game developement engines and im going to document my progress
and everything between inside of my blogs in the hopes that it may help somebody else and also for myself.
In addition to that i am also going to showcase my already existing game projects on here and provide
some insights into their creation processes.

At this point i am also running a custom server for the aforementioned game series as the official servers
have (unsurprisingly) been shut down. I'm using open source software for this, which is convenient for me
as i'm actually not very experienced in networking. We also have a relatively big team at this point alongside
a Discord Server, it's my most successful project by far so there will be a seperate page dedicated to it.

I also have an (inactive) YouTube channel and a lot more social media, almost all of which you'll be able to
find on my social media page. I'm also learning html and css right now so this website will definitely
improve in functionality and design as time goes on and i gain more experience.
Oh, and im also bilingual, i speak both german and english fluently and see both as my "native"
languages, since i've grown up learning both. I use English primarily though, for pretty much everything
that doesn't involve speaking with people in real life (including thinking most of the time) as i live in Germany.

Anyway, i hope that's enough of an introduction and that you'll enjoy following my journey!

items.title: Der Fall der Weisen
items.summary: Der Fall der Weisen was one of the first projects i've ever participated on with other people, and i met quite a few…
items.content_html:
Der Fall der Weisen was one of the first projects i've ever participated on with other people, and i met quite a few people through it like Toastbrot and Steven4Zimmer who went one to become some of my best friends, which is why im very fond and nostalgic about this project, its the beginning of something big.Â 

The level itself also has a very mystical and eerie atmosphere, but not in a bad way, its hard to describe, its the kind of magic Steven4Zimmer always brought to the table, it's sad that i don't have much contact with him anymore, but i do with Toastbrot. It was made at a time where we could just wake up and work on our projects the whole day every day.

It's a puzzle level with a bunch of cinematic (and sometimes funny) elements with a bunch of little surprises along the way.

items.title: Infinite
items.summary: The official servers for the game series LittleBigPlanet shut down a while ago, and Infinite is one of the custom servers aiming to…
items.content_html:
The official servers for the game series LittleBigPlanet shut down a while ago, and Infinite is one of the custom servers aiming to bring back its online functionality. To access the servers users have to modify their Playstation 3 by jailbreaking it so that the eboot.bin file (which is essentially the executable file of the game) can be modefied to connect to our server, instead of the old one, which is, of course, shut down.

I'm lucky to have a passionate and dedicated Team by my side, thanks to all of our efforts and our community, Infinite became one of the biggest custom servers and we're constantly working on bringing new features and updates to the table, to keep it fresh.

You can check out the server's website here:Â Infinite

And it's discord here: Infinite's Discord

items.title: Choosing an Engine
items.summary: Welcome to my first blog post! So i have decided that im going to be primarily using Gamemaker Studio 2 for 2D games,…
items.content_html:
Welcome to my first blog post!

So i have decided that im going to be primarily using Gamemaker Studio 2
for 2D games, and Unreal Engine for 3D games. I have tested Gamemaker
for a while now and i find it to be easy and convenient to use,
it also only requires a one-time fee to start commercially selling your games.
Most engines are going to take a cut once your game has sold a certrain number
of copies, but not Gamemaker (or Godot). But the downside to Gamemaker is that
you can't create 3D games, at least not without tricking the hell out of
the engine. So im going to be using Unreal for 3D, i've been considering Unity,
however since the whole drama that happened where they wanted to charge game
devs for installations, i don't think that's a good idea.

Both Unreal and Unity feature a visual programming language, similar to the one in used back in LittleBigPlanet. So i'd probably be able to get into it pretty quickly, however
for Gamemaker at least i do want to use its dedicated gml code as much as possible,
because it would improve my traditonal coding skills, for Unreal i think i'll use
their blueprint system primarily though, as they only offer c++ as an alternative
which im not very interested in learning right now, blueprints seem to be powerful enough.

I had also been learning Renpy a while back, it's an engine and programming language for the developement of visual novels and it's very easy to use, i feel like i got the most
importing things figured out about it, right now i dont really want to focus on visual
novel stuff though, but it's nice to know i suppose.

Alright so i'm currently watching a bunch of tutorials on Gamemaker, i already learned some stuff but its all still very basic. And without tutorials i cant really make much at all,
so im kind of trapped in tutorial hell right now. I'll try to participate in Game Jams
as soon as possible as its the quickest and best way to learn in game developement from what i've seen.

But first i want to finish a short experimental Platformer game first called Rainhiker,
so i can gain some more skill before actually participating in any Game Jams.
I only have a rough concept for the game right now i do think i can make something
out of it...
